segments.en: The Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha …

segments.pli: ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rādho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
“sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yamahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto vihareyyan”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ kho, rādha, aniccaṃ tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Rādha, you should give up desire for what is impermanent.

segments.pli: Kiñca, rādha, aniccaṃ tatra te chando pahātabbo?
yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ. Tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
segments.en: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also impermanent. You should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: mano anicco. Tatra te chando pahātabbo.
yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ. Tatra te chando pahātabbo.
segments.en: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also impermanent. You should give up desire for it.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho, rādha, aniccaṃ tatra te chando pahātabbo”ti.
segments.en: You should give up desire for what is impermanent.”

sections.title: The Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Rādha asks for a teaching to take on retreat. The Buddha told him to abandon desire for sense experience, which is impermanent.
